lead_paragraph: In more than five hours of conversations — the last extensive biographical interviews he granted before running for president — Mr. Trump makes clear how difficult it is for him to imagine, let alone accept, defeat.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alexander Burns, Nicholas Confessore, Maggie Haberman, Jason Horowitz, Jonathan Mahler, Diantha Parker and Vanessa Romo.

headline.print_headline: What Drives Trump? A Fear of Fading Away
headline.main: What Drives Donald Trump? Fear of Losing Status, Tapes Show

snippet: In more than five hours of conversations — the last extensive biographical interviews he granted before running for president — Mr. Trump makes clear how difficult it is for him to imagine, let alone accept, defeat....
abstract: Biographical interviews with Donald Trump conducted by journalist Michael D'Antonio and recorded just before his run for president reveal Trump's fixation on his own celebrity and anxiety over fading from public eye; interviews also show Trump's love of conflict and scorn of people who lose their celebrity status; D'Antonio turned tapes of interviews over to New York Times after coming to disapprove of Trump's candidacy.
